channel.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
channel.description:
I have a emachine T2892.. I was having trouble with my processor underclocking, so I took my video card out (ati x1650) to see if it would run to speed.. It didnt, so I went to bios and restored to default settings.. It worked...
NOW, my computer stays on and the monitor just randomly turns off... Its gotten to the point where it wont make it past the boot logo and its not the monitor... Ive tried a fresh install on it, but while I'm in the middle of doing it, the monitor shuts off. I have plugged the monitor into the integrated gfx card on the motherboard and it does the same thing.
Help :(

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

I don’t have another monitor but one of my parents… But Im bringing it into work today, if they cant figure it out then ill try one of theirs.

EDIT: It does it with the nVidea card (integrated) and the ATI card (not integrated)

Read full topic
item.source: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

do other monitors work on the machine? if not your card may not be plugged in properly(best case) or it may be dying(worse case)

Read full topic
item.source: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

Hmm, Well I downgraded from win7 to XP, shortly after (a few days) I started having the problem. But I tried installing XP on it again and After the hdd was formatted it did it again and everytime I try installing XP or Linux it turns off after booting into the CD…

Read full topic
item.source: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

I’m willing to bet the problem is with the software rather than with the hardware. Do you happen to run Windows XP? This same exact problem occurred on my dad’s PC a couple of months ago and after re-installing graphic drivers, modifying all settings known to man, and googling to no avail, I gave up and simply installed Windows 7 – it was time for an update anyways. No problem since.

Read full topic
item.source: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

I’m using the monitor in a netbook at the moment… Works perfect.

Read full topic
item.source: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?

item.title: Monitor shuts off, Computer stays on?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Is it possible for you to plug the monitor into a different PC to see if it is actually a broken monitor or if it is the computer causing the problems.

Read full topic
